intro: Kadua knudsenii, commonly known as the Knudsen's kadua, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Kadua knudsenii is considered a rare and endangered species.
